clinical_study.brief_title: A Multi-Center Cohort Study of Risk Factors and Outcomes of Encephalopathy of Prematurity in China
clinical_study.official_title: A Multi-Center Cohort Study of Risk Factors and Outcomes of Encephalopathy of Prematurity in China

brief_summary.textblock: The purpose of this study is to explore the perinatal risk factors of encephalopathy of prematurity and the morbidity of the following neurodevelopmental impairments in preterm infants with gestational age <32 weeks in China.

detailed_description.textblock: Recent years have witnessed an increase in survival of very or extremely low birth weight infants, with a corresponding increase of attention to encephalopathy of prematurity (EOP) and the following neurological disorders. Studies suggested that hypoxic-ischemic injury and perinatal infection might be the two main risk factors of EOP, including white matter injury, neuronal-axonal diseases and cerebellar hemorrhage, which have a strong impact on neurological outcomes. Sequelae like cerebral palsy or mental retardation become a burden to both the family and society. Therefore, the risk factors of brain injury become the critical issue of both Obstetrics and Neonatology. More importantly, little is known about the morbidity of neurodevelopmental impairment and its risk factors in China. Thus, the aim of our study is to explore the perinatal risk factors of encephalopathy of prematurity and the morbidity of the following neurodevelopmental impairments in preterm infants with gestational age <32 weeks in China.

primary_outcome.measure: developmental quotient (DQ) on the Gesell Developmental Schedules
primary_outcome.description: Result of gross motor, fine motor, language and social test. DQ = Development Age / Chronological Age X 100

secondary_outcome.time_frame: 36-40 weeks' postmenstrual age or before discharge
secondary_outcome.description: signal abnormality in white matter, grey matter or cerebellum injury; periventricular leukomalacia; intracranial hemorrhage

secondary_outcome.time_frame: 36-40 weeks' postmenstrual age or before discharge
secondary_outcome.description: white matter injury, grey matter injury, cerebellum injury on MRI
including cerebral palsy, epilepsy, hearing loss, vision loss, etc.

arm_group.description: infants with encephalopathy of prematurity showed on MRI at term-equivalent age
infants with no encephalopathy of prematurity showed on MRI at term-equivalent age

criteria.textblock:
Inclusion Criteria:
- preterm infants with gestational age <32 weeks
Exclusion Criteria:
- major congenital malformations
- chromosomal disorders
- metabolic diseases
